meanings.definition: To move or cause to move quickly back and forth or from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The cat was willying its tail in excitement.
meanings.sent2: She was willying the jump rope with great speed.
meanings.sent3: The willying squirrel made everyone laugh at the park.
meanings.sent4: The willying wind shook the trees violently.
meanings.sent5: The willying motion of the swing made her dizzy.

meanings.definition: To toss or throw something with a quick, jerky motion.
meanings.sent1: He was willying the ball to his friend across the field.
meanings.sent2: The chef was willying the vegetables into the pan.
meanings.sent3: The willying magician amazed the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: She willying her hair tie onto the dresser in a hurry.
meanings.sent5: The willying motion of the frisbee caught everyone's attention.
